title: Causal inference for qualitative outcomes
text: causalQual package provides suite tools estimating causal effects outcome interest qualitative - .e., multinomial ordered. Standard causal inference methods instrumental variables (IV), regression discontinuity (RD), difference--differences () typically designed numeric outcomes. direct application qualitative outcomes leads ill-defined estimands, rendering results arbitrary uninterpretable. package implements framework introduced Di Francesco Mellace (2025), shifting focus well-defined interpretable estimands quantify treatment affects probability distribution outcome categories. methods remain compatible conventional research designs, ensuring ease implementation applied researchers.

title: Causal inference for qualitative outcomes
text: ‚úî Implements causal inference methods qualitative outcomes ‚úî Supports selection--observables, IV, RD, ‚úî Open-source extensible

what: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
code: causalQual_did(Y_pre, Y_post, D)

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
text: Y_pre Qualitative outcome treatment. Must labeled \(\{1, 2, \dots\}\). Y_post Qualitative outcome treatment. Must labeled \(\{1, 2, \dots\}\). D Binary treatment indicator.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
text: object class causalQual.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
text: difference--difference design, identification requires probabilities time shift \(Y_{} (0)\) class \(m\) evolve similarly treated control groups (parallel trends probability mass functions \(Y_{}(0)\)). assumption holds, can recover probability shift treated class \(m\): $$\delta_{m, T} := P(Y_{} (1) = m | D_i = 1) - P(Y_{}(0) = m | D_i = 1).$$ causalQual_did applies, class \(m\), canonical two-group/two-period method binary variable \(1(Y_{} = m)\). Specifically, consider following linear model: $$1(Y_{} = m) = D_i \beta_{m1} + 1(s = t) \beta_{m2} + D_i 1(s = t) \beta_{m3} + \epsilon_{mis}.$$ OLS estimate \(\hat{\beta}_{m3}\) \(\beta_{m3}\) estimate probability shift treated class m. Standard errors clustered unit level used construct conventional confidence intervals.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Difference-in-Differences ‚Äî causalQual_did
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_did(1000, assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered")  Y_pre <- data$Y_pre Y_post <- data$Y_post D <- data$D  ## Estimate probabilities of shift on the treated. fit <- causalQual_did(Y_pre, Y_post, D)  summary(fit) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ CAUSAL INFERENCE WITH QUALITATIVE OUTCOMES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Research design ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Identification:          Difference-in-Differences  #> Estimand:                Probability Shifts on the Treated  #> Outcome type:             #> Classes:                 1 2 3  #> N. units:                1000  #> Fraction treated units:  0.49  #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Point estimates and 95\% confidence intervals ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Class 1: -0.535  [-0.605, -0.466] #> Class 2: -0.107  [-0.177, -0.036] #> Class 3:  0.642  [ 0.585,  0.699] plot(fit)

what: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
text: Fit two-stage least squares models qualitative outcomes estimate local probabilities shift.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
code: causalQual_iv(Y, D, Z)

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
text: Y Qualitative outcome treatment. Must labeled \(\{1, 2, \dots\}\). D Binary treatment indicator. Z Binary instrument.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
text: object class causalQual.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
text: instrumental-variables design, identification requires instrument independent potential outcomes potential treatments (exogeneity), instrument influences outcome solely effect treatment (exclusion restriction), instrument nonzero effect treatment probability (relevance), instrument can increase/decrease treatment probability (monotonicity). assumptions hold, can recover local probabilities shift classes: $$\delta_{m, L} := P(Y_i(1) = m | \, \, complier) - P(Y_i(0) = m | \, \, complier), \, m = 1, \dots, M.$$ causalQual_iv applies, class m, standard two-stage least squares method binary variable \(1(Y_i = m)\). Specifically, routine first estimates following first-stage regression model via OLS: $$D_i = \gamma_0 + \gamma_1 Z_i + \nu_i,$$ constructs predicted values \(\hat{D}_i\). uses predicted values second-stage regressions: $$1(Y_i = m) = \alpha_{m0} + \alpha_{m1} \hat{D}_i + \epsilon_{mi}, \quad m = 1, \dots, M.$$ OLS estimate \(\hat{\alpha}_{m1}\) \(\alpha_{m1}\) estimate \(\delta_{m, L}\). Standard errors computed using conventional procedures used construct conventional confidence intervals. done calling ivreg function.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Instrumental Variables ‚Äî causalQual_iv
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_iv(1000, outcome_type = "ordered")  Y <- data$Y D <- data$D Z <- data$Z  ## Estimate local probabilities of shift. fit <- causalQual_iv(Y, D, Z)  summary(fit) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ CAUSAL INFERENCE WITH QUALITATIVE OUTCOMES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Research design ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Identification:          Instrumental Variables  #> Estimand:                Local Probability Shifts  #> Outcome type:             #> Classes:                 1 2 3  #> N. units:                1000  #> Fraction treated units:  0.498  #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Point estimates and 95\% confidence intervals ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Class 1: -0.673  [-0.806, -0.539] #> Class 2:  0.028  [-0.113,  0.169] #> Class 3:  0.644  [ 0.512,  0.776] plot(fit)

what: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
text: Fit local polynomial regression models qualitative outcomes estimate probabilities shift cutoff.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
code: causalQual_rd(Y, running_variable, cutoff)

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
text: Y Qualitative outcome. Must labeled \(\{1, 2, \dots\}\). running_variable Running variable determining treatment assignment. cutoff Cutoff threshold. Units running_variable < cutoff considered controls, units running_variable >= cutoff considered treated.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
text: object class causalQual.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
text: regression discontinuity design, identification requires probability mass functions class \(m\) potential outcomes continuous running variable (continuity). assumption holds, can recover probability shift cutoff class \(m\): $$\delta_{m, C} := P(Y_i (1) = m | Running_i = cutoff) - P(Y_i(0) = m | Running_i = cutoff).$$ causalQual_rd applies, class \(m\), standard local polynomial estimators binary variable \(1(Y_i = m)\). Specifically, ruotine implements robust bias-corrected inference procedure Calonico et al. (2014) (see rdrobust function).

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Regression Discontinuity ‚Äî causalQual_rd
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_rd(1000, outcome_type = "ordered")  Y <- data$Y running_variable <- data$running_variable cutoff <- data$cutoff  ## Estimate probabilities of shift at the cutoff. fit <- causalQual_rd(Y, running_variable, cutoff)  summary(fit) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ CAUSAL INFERENCE WITH QUALITATIVE OUTCOMES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Research design ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Identification:          Regression Discontinuity  #> Estimand:                Probability Shifts at the Cutoff  #> Outcome type:             #> Classes:                 1 2 3  #> N. units:                0  #> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA #> Fraction treated units:  NA  #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Point estimates and 95\% confidence intervals ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Class 1: -0.840  [-1.051, -0.628] #> Class 2: -0.006  [-0.193,  0.181] #> Class 3:  0.981  [ 0.737,  1.226] plot(fit)

what: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
text: Construct average doubly robust scores qualitative outcomes estimate probabilities shift.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
code: causalQual_soo(Y, D, X, outcome_type, K = 5)

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
text: Y Qualitative outcome. Must labeled \(\{1, 2, \dots\}\). D Binary treatment indicator. X Covariate matrix (intercept). outcome_type String controlling outcome type. Must either "multinomial" "ordered". Affects estimation conditional class probabilities. K Number folds nuisance functions estimation.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
text: object class causalQual.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
text: selection--observables design, identification requires treatment indicator (conditionally) independent potential outcomes (unconfoundedness), unit non-zero probability treated (common support). assumptions hold, can recover probabilities shift classes: $$\delta_m := P(Y_i(1) = m) - P(Y_i(0) = m), \, m = 1, \dots, M.$$ causalQual_soo constructs averages doubly robust scores qualitative outcomes estimate \(\delta_m\). class \(m\), doubly robust score unit \(\) defined : $$     \hat{\Gamma}_{m, } =     \hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 1, X_i) -     \hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 0, X_i) + $$ $$     D_i \frac{1\{Y_i = m\} - \hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 1, X_i)}     {\hat{P}(D_i = 1 | X_i)}     - (1 - D_i) \frac{1\{Y_i = m\} - \hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 0, X_i)}     {1 - \hat{P}(D_i = 1 | X_i)}. $$ estimator \(\delta_m\) average scores: $$\hat{\delta}_m = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{=1}^{n} \hat{\Gamma}_{m, },$$ variance estimated : $$     \widehat{\text{Var}} ( \hat{\delta}_m ) = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{=1}^{n} ( \hat{\Gamma}_{m, } - \hat{\delta}_m )^2. $$ causalQual_soo uses estimates construct confidence intervals based conventional normal approximations. outcome_type == "multinomial", \(\hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 1, X_i)\) \(\hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 0, X_i)\) estimated using multinomial_ml strategy regression forests base learners. Else, outcome_type == "ordered", \(\hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 1, X_i)\) \(\hat{P}(Y_i = m \mid D_i = 0, X_i)\) estimated using honest version ocf estimator. \(\hat{P}(D_i = 1 | X_i)\) always estimated via honest regression_forest. K-fold cross-fitting employed estimation functions. Folds created random split. class Y observed one folds one treatment groups, new random partition performed. process repeat classes observed folds treatment groups 1000 times, routine raises error.

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Causal Inference for Qualitative Outcomes under Selection-on-Observables ‚Äî causalQual_soo
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_soo(1000, assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered") Y <- data$Y D <- data$D X <- data$X  # Estimate probabilities of shift. fit <- causalQual_soo(Y, D, X, outcome_type = "ordered", K = 2)  summary(fit) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ CAUSAL INFERENCE WITH QUALITATIVE OUTCOMES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Research design ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Identification:          Selection-on-Observables  #> Estimand:                Probability shifts  #> Outcome type:            ordered  #> Classes:                 1 2 3  #> N. units:                1000  #> Fraction treated units:  0.516  #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Point estimates and 95\% confidence intervals ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Class 1: -0.556  [-0.614, -0.498] #> Class 2: -0.036  [-0.096,  0.025] #> Class 3:  0.592  [ 0.538,  0.646] plot(fit)

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: Generate synthetic data set qualitative outcomes difference--differences design. data include two time periods, binary treatment indicator (applied second period), matrix covariates. Probabilities time shift among treated control groups evolve similarly across two time periods (parallel trends probability mass functions).

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
code: generate_qualitative_data_did(n, assignment, outcome_type)

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: n Sample size. assignment String controlling treatment assignment. Must either "randomized" (random assignment) "observational" (assignment based covariates). outcome_type String controlling outcome type. Must either "multinomial" "ordered".

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: list storing data frame observed data, true propensity score, true probabilities shift treated.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: Potential outcomes generated differently according outcome_type. outcome_type == "multinomial", generate_qualitative_data_did computes linear predictors class using covariates: $$\eta_{mi} (d, s) = \beta_{m1}^d X_{i1} + \beta_{m2}^d X_{i2} + \beta_{m3}^d X_{i3}, \quad d = 0, 1, \quad s = t-1, t,$$ transforms \(\eta_{mi} (d, s)\) valid probability distributions using softmax function: $$P(Y_{}(d) = m | X_i) = \frac{\exp(\eta_{mi} (d, s))}{\sum_{m'} \exp(\eta_{m'}(d, s))}, \quad d = 0, 1, \quad s = t-1, t.$$ generates potential outcomes \(Y_{-1}(1)\), \(Y_{}(1)\), \(Y_{-1}(0)\), \(Y_{}(0)\) sampling {1, 2, 3} using \(P(Y(d, s) = m \mid X), \, d = 0, 1, \, s = t-1, t\). instead outcome_type == "ordered", generate_qualitative_data_did first generates latent potential outcomes: $$Y_i^* (d, s) = \tau d + X_{i1} + X_{i2} + X_{i3} + N (0, 1), \quad d = 0, 1, \quad s = t-1, t,$$ \(\tau = 2\). constructs \(Y_i (d, s)\) discretizing \(Y_i^* (d, s)\) using threshold parameters \(\zeta_1 = 2\) \(\zeta_2 = 4\). , $$P(Y_i(d, s) = m | X_i) = P(\zeta_{m-1} < Y_i^*(d, s) \leq \zeta_m | X_i) = \Phi (\zeta_m - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d) - \Phi (\zeta_{m-1} - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d), \quad d = 0, 1, \quad s = t-1, t,$$ allows us analytically compute probabilities shift treated.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: Treatment always assigned \(D_i \sim \text{Bernoulli}(\pi(X_i))\). assignment == "randomized", propensity score specified \(\pi(X_i) = P ( D_i = 1 | X_i)) = 0.5\). instead assignment == "observational", \(\pi(X_i) = (X_{i1} + X_{i3}) / 2\).

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: function always generates three independent covariates \(U(0,1)\). Observed outcomes \(Y_{}\) always constructed using usual observational rule.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Difference-in-Differences) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_did
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_did(100,                                       assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered")  data$pshifts_treated #> [1] -0.54695394 -0.06938273  0.61633667

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: Generate synthetic data set qualitative outcomes instrumental variables design. data include binary treatment indicator binary instrument. Potential outcomes potential treatments independent instrument. Moreover, instrument directly impact potential outcomes, impact treatment probability, can increase probability treatment.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
code: generate_qualitative_data_iv(n, outcome_type)

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: n Sample size. outcome_type String controlling outcome type. Must either "multinomial" "ordered". Affects potential outcomes generated.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: list storing data frame observed data, true propensity score, true instrument propensity score, true local probabilities shift.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: Potential outcomes generated differently according outcome_type. outcome_type == "multinomial", generate_qualitative_data_iv computes linear predictors class using covariates: $$\eta_{mi} (d) = \beta_{m1}^d X_{i1} + \beta_{m2}^d X_{i2} + \beta_{m3}^d X_{i3}, \quad d = 0, 1,$$ transforms \(\eta_{mi} (d)\) valid probability distributions using softmax function: $$P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i) = \frac{\exp(\eta_{mi} (d))}{\sum_{m'} \exp(\eta_{m'}(d))}, \quad d = 0, 1.$$ generates potential outcomes \(Y_i(1)\) \(Y_i(0)\) sampling {1, 2, 3} using \(P_i(Y(d) = m | X), \, d = 0, 1\). instead outcome_type == "ordered", generate_qualitative_data_iv first generates latent potential outcomes: $$Y_i^* (d) = \tau d + X_{i1} + X_{i2} + X_{i3} + N (0, 1), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ \(\tau = 2\). constructs \(Y_i (d)\) discretizing \(Y_i^* (d)\) using threshold parameters \(\zeta_1 = 2\) \(\zeta_2 = 4\). , $$P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i) = P(\zeta_{m-1} < Y_i^*(d) \leq \zeta_m | X_i) = \Phi (\zeta_m - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d) - \Phi (\zeta_{m-1} - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ allows us analytically compute local probabilities shift.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: instrument always generated \(Z_i \sim \text{Bernoulli}(0.5)\). Treatment always modeled \(D_i \sim \text{Bernoulli}(\pi(X_i, Z_i))\), \(\pi(X_i, Z_i) = P ( D_i = 1 | X_i, Z_i)) = (X_{i1} + X_{i3} + Z_i) / 3\). Thus, \(Z_i\) can increase probability treatment intake decrease .

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: function always generates three independent covariates \(U(0,1)\). Observed outcomes \(Y_i\) always constructed using usual observational rule.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Instrumental Variables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_iv
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_iv(100,                                      outcome_type = "ordered")  data$local_pshifts #> [1] -0.576468964 -0.003873771  0.580342735

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: Generate synthetic data set qualitative outcomes regression discontinuity design. data include binary treatment indicator single covariate (running variable). conditional probability mass fuctions potential outcomes continuous running variable.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
code: generate_qualitative_data_rd(n, outcome_type)

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: n Sample size. outcome_type String controlling outcome type. Must either "multinomial" "ordered". Affects potential outcomes generated.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: list storing data frame observed data, true probabilities shift cutoff.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: Potential outcomes generated differently according outcome_type. outcome_type == "multinomial", generate_qualitative_data_rd computes linear predictors class using covariates: $$\eta_{mi} (d) = \beta_{m1}^d X_{i1} + \beta_{m2}^d X_{i2} + \beta_{m3}^d X_{i3}, \quad d = 0, 1,$$ transforms \(\eta_{mi} (d)\) valid probability distributions using softmax function: $$P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i) = \frac{\exp(\eta_{mi} (d))}{\sum_{m'} \exp(\eta_{m'}(d))}.$$ generates potential outcomes \(Y_i(1)\) \(Y_i(0)\) sampling {1, 2, 3} using \(P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i), \, d = 0, 1\). instead outcome_type == "ordered", generate_qualitative_data_rd first generates latent potential outcomes: $$Y_i^* (d) = \tau d + X_{i1} + X_{i2} + X_{i3} + N (0, 1), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ \(\tau = 2\). constructs \(Y_i (d)\) discretizing \(Y_i^* (d)\) using threshold parameters \(\zeta_1 = 2\) \(\zeta_2 = 4\). , $$P(Y_i(d) = m) = P(\zeta_{m-1} < Y_i^*(d) \leq \zeta_m) = \Phi (\zeta_m - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d) - \Phi (\zeta_{m-1} - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ allows us analytically compute probabilities shift cutoff.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: Treatment always assigned \(D_i = 1(X_i \geq 0.5)\).

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: function always generates three independent covariates \(U(0,1)\). Observed outcomes \(Y_i\) always constructed using usual observational rule.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Regression Discontinuity) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_rd
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_rd(100,                                      outcome_type = "ordered")  data$pshifts_cutoff #> [1] -0.5267177 -0.1136908  0.6404085

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: Generate synthetic data set qualitative outcomes selection--observables design. data include binary treatment indicator matrix covariates. treatment either independent conditionally (covariates) independent potential outcomes, depending users' choices.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
code: generate_qualitative_data_soo(n, assignment, outcome_type)

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: n Sample size. assignment String controlling treatment assignment. Must either "randomized" (random assignment) "observational" (random assigment conditional generated covariates). outcome_type String controlling outcome type. Must either "multinomial" "ordered". Affects potential outcomes generated.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: list storing data frame observed data, true propensity score, true probabilities shift.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: Potential outcomes generated differently according outcome_type. outcome_type == "multinomial", generate_qualitative_data_soo computes linear predictors class using covariates: $$\eta_{mi} (d) = \beta_{m1}^d X_{i1} + \beta_{m2}^d X_{i2} + \beta_{m3}^d X_{i3}, \quad d = 0, 1,$$ transforms \(\eta_{mi} (d)\) valid probability distributions using softmax function: $$P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i) = \frac{\exp(\eta_{mi} (d))}{\sum_{m'} \exp(\eta_{m'}(d))}, \quad d = 0, 1.$$ generates potential outcomes \(Y_i(1)\) \(Y_i(0)\) sampling {1, 2, 3} using \(P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i), \, d = 0, 1\). instead outcome_type == "ordered", generate_qualitative_data_soo first generates latent potential outcomes: $$Y_i^* (d) = \tau d + X_{i1} + X_{i2} + X_{i3} + N (0, 1), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ \(\tau = 2\). constructs \(Y_i (d)\) discretizing \(Y_i^* (d)\) using threshold parameters \(\zeta_1 = 2\) \(\zeta_2 = 4\). , $$P(Y_i(d) = m | X_i) = P(\zeta_{m-1} < Y_i^*(d) \leq \zeta_m | X_i) = \Phi (\zeta_m - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d) - \Phi (\zeta_{m-1} - \sum_j X_{ij} - \tau d), \quad d = 0, 1,$$ allows us analytically compute probabilities shift.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: Treatment always assigned \(D_i \sim \text{Bernoulli}(\pi(X_i))\). assignment == "randomized", propensity score specified \(\pi(X_i) = P ( D_i = 1 | X_i)) = 0.5\). instead assignment == "observational", \(\pi(X_i) = (X_{i1} + X_{i3}) / 2\).

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: function always generates three independent covariates \(U(0,1)\). Observed outcomes \(Y_i\) always constructed using usual observational rule.

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
text: Riccardo Di Francesco

title: Generate Qualitative Data (Selection-on-Observables) ‚Äî generate_qualitative_data_soo
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_soo(100,                                       assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered")  data$pshifts #> [1] -0.577876162 -0.006807437  0.584683599

code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_soo(1000, assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered") Y <- data$Y D <- data$D X <- data$X  ## Estimate probabilities of shifts. fit <- causalQual_soo(Y = Y, D = D, X = X, outcome_type = "ordered") plot(fit)

title: Print Method for causalQual Objects ‚Äî print.causalQual
code: ## Generate synthetic data. set.seed(1986)  data <- generate_qualitative_data_soo(1000, assignment = "observational",                                       outcome_type = "ordered") Y <- data$Y D <- data$D X <- data$X  ## Estimate probabilities of shifts. fit <- causalQual_soo(Y = Y, D = D, X = X, outcome_type = "ordered") print(fit) #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ CAUSAL INFERENCE WITH QUALITATIVE OUTCOMES ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Research design ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Identification:          Selection-on-Observables  #> Estimand:                Probability shifts  #> Outcome type:            ordered  #> Classes:                 1 2 3  #> N. units:                1000  #> Fraction treated units:  0.516  #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ Point estimates and 95\% confidence intervals ‚îÄ‚îÄ #>  #> Class 1: -0.566  [-0.622, -0.510] #> Class 2: -0.029  [-0.087,  0.030] #> Class 3:  0.595  [ 0.542,  0.648]
